page.title: 04CALSHOT.
page.content: Before 1913, when a flying boat base was established at Calshot Spit, the area was fields and marshland. Calshot today is a small village with two Communities, split by the road to the beach. Calshot Close area to the east is used as married quarters for the army based at Marchwood. Tristan Close on the west is the original R.A.F. quarters. This is also where the people of Tristan da Cunha lived when they had to flee their island because of volcanic action in 1961. Each estate has its own community club with activities for adults and children who also have their own play areas. There is a general store, P.O. and a garage. St. Georges chapel has a service each Sunday. The Flying Boat Inn which serves food and drink was the original officers mess. The stony beach near Calshot has weekend huts for tourists.
